action.action-desc: Mr. Vindman (for himself, Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania, Mr. Lawler, Ms. McDonald Rivet, Mr. Subramanyam, Mr. Fitzpatrick, and Mr. Mannion) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to carry out an awareness campaign with respect to spotted lanternflies.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the If You See It, Squish It Act of 2025.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Agriculture (in this section referred to as the Secretary) shall carry out a national campaign to increase the awareness and knowledge of the public with respect to spotted lanternflies.
In carrying out the national campaign under this section, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.text: place public service announcements on television, radio, and billboards in areas of high incidence of spotted lanternflies that—

subparagraph.text: inform individuals of the fact that spotted lanternflies are an invasive pest that threaten local agriculture; and
encourage individuals to kill any spotted lanternflies that such individuals encounter; and

paragraph.text: use such other awareness tools as the Secretary determines appropriate to provide the information described in paragraph (1).
